com.jenjinstudios.io.authentication

Interface Authenticator<T extends ExecutionContext>


  • public interface Authenticator<T extends ExecutionContext>
    Interface defining several methods that are useful for authentication.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String PASSWORD
      This constant is provided an a convenience, to specify a "password" credential in a Map.
      static java.lang.String VERIFICATION_CODE
      This constant is provided an a convenience, to specify a "verification code" credential in a Map.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean authenticate(T context, java.lang.String id, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> credentials)
      Authenticate the user with the given unique id and valid credentials and, if successful, populating the given ExecutionContext with the user data from the backing data store.
      default boolean authenticate(T context, java.lang.String id, java.lang.String password)
      Authenticate the user with the given unique id and valid password and, if successful, populating the given ExecutionContext with the user data from the backing data store.
      void close()
      Close the backing database connection.

      Determine whether the given credentials are valid for the user with the specified unique identifier.

    • Method Detail

      • isAuthenticated

        boolean isAuthenticated(java.lang.String id)
                 throws AuthenticationException
        Determine whether the user specified by the given unique identifier is authenticated. Behavior when the user doesn't exist is implementation-dependent.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique user identifier.
        Returns:
        Whether the user is authenticated.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If there is an exception when determining authentication status.

      • userExists

        boolean userExists(java.lang.String id)
            throws AuthenticationException
        Determine whether the user specified by the given unique identifier exists.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique identifier of the user.
        Returns:
        Whether the user with the given identifier exists.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If there is an exception when determining if the user exists/

      • credentialsValid

        boolean credentialsValid(java.lang.String id,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> credentials)
                  throws AuthenticationException
        Determine whether the given credentials are valid for the user with the specified unique identifier. Behavior when the user doesn't exist is implementation-dependent.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique user identifier.
        credentials - A map of credentials containing key-value pairs, where the key is the name of credential and the value is the plaintext credential. Several constants that may be helpful key choices are provided by this interface.
        Returns:
        Whether the given credentials are valid.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If there is an exception when determining the validity of the credentials.

      • passwordValid

        default boolean passwordValid(java.lang.String id,
                              java.lang.String password)
                       throws AuthenticationException
        Determine whether the given password is valid. By default, this method assumes that the PASSWORD constant is the key used for storing passwords in the credentials Map.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique user identifier.
        password - The plaintext password.
        Returns:
        Whether the password is valid.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If there is an exception when determining password validity.

      • authenticate

        boolean authenticate(T context,
                     java.lang.String id,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> credentials)
              throws AuthenticationException
        Authenticate the user with the given unique id and valid credentials and, if successful, populating the given ExecutionContext with the user data from the backing data store. A suggested method behavior is: 
          boolean canLogin =
       this.userExists(id) && !this.isAuthenticated(id) && this.credentialsValid(id,credentials);
   if (canLogin) {
       populate(context, id);
   }
   return canLogin;
        Parameters:
        context - The context to be populated with user data if authentication is successful. This object should not be modified if the authentication was unsuccessful.
        id - The unique user identifier.
        credentials - A map of credentials containing key-value pairs, where the key is the name of credential and the value is the plaintext credential. Several constants that may be helpful key choices are provided by this interface.
        Returns:
        Whether the user was successfully authenticated. If the user was not successfully authenticated, it is imperative that the context parameter not be modified.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If there is an exception when authenticating the user.

      • authenticate

        default boolean authenticate(T context,
                             java.lang.String id,
                             java.lang.String password)
                      throws AuthenticationException
        Authenticate the user with the given unique id and valid password and, if successful, populating the given ExecutionContext with the user data from the backing data store. By default, this method assumes that the PASSWORD constant is the key used for storing passwords in the credentials Map.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to be populated with user data if authentication is successful. This object should not be modified if the authentication was unsuccessful.
        id - The unique user identifier.
        password - The plaintext password.
        Returns:
        Whether the user was successfully authenticated. If the user was not successfully authenticated, it is imperative that the context parameter not be modified.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If there is an exception when authenticating the user.

      • unauthenticate

        boolean unauthenticate(T context,
                       java.lang.String id)
                throws AuthenticationException
        Unauthenticate the user with the given unique id, restoring the given context to an unauthenticated state.
        Parameters:
        context - The context for the user to be unauthenticated; should
        id - The unique user identifier.
        Returns:
        Whether the user was successfully unauthenticated and the context was modified.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If there is an exception during unauthentication.

      • populate

        void populate(T context,
              java.lang.String id)
       throws AuthenticationException
        Populate the given ExecutionContext with data for the user with the given unique identifier.

        Note: This method should not attempt any sort of authentication; credentials are not provided, it exists for the sole purpose of retrieving and populating user data. For authentication, use the credentialsValid(String, Map), authenticate(ExecutionContext, String, Map), and authenticate(ExecutionContext, String, String) methods.
        Parameters:
        context - The context to populate with user data.
        id - The unique user identifier.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If there is an exception when populating the user data.

      • update

        boolean update(T context,
               java.lang.String id)
        throws AuthenticationException
        Update the backing data store, for the user with the given id, with data from the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - The context containing data to be placed in the backing data store.
        id - The unique user id.
        Returns:
        true If the update was successful and the backing data store was modified.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If there is an exception during the update.

      • close

        void close()
    throws AuthenticationException
        Close the backing database connection.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If there is an exception when closing the backing database connection.
